key_title: Key to the subspecies of Notogrammitis

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the families of ferns and allied plants
Key to the genera of Polypodiaceae

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lamina undivided, narrowly lanceolate or obolanceolate; sori linear to oblong, in a single row on each side of midvein
Lamina pinnately divided, pinnae decurrent along rachis; sori oval, singly on lobes
Rhizome short, unbranched; fronds usually more than 3 cm long; fertile fronds with more than 4 pairs of sori
Rhizome long-creeping, branched; fronds less than 3 cm long; fertile fronds with 1–4 pairs of sori, confluent to form rounded mass
Sori oblique to midvein (at least towards tip of frond); stipe hairs sparse to common; lamina 0.4–0.7 (rarely to 0.9) cm wide
Sori slightly oblique or parallel to midvein; stipe hairs absent to very rare; lamina 0.2–0.5 cm wide
